page.title: 20Social Concerns
page.content:
Flooding in the valley has been a problem for many years. The river is tidal to Trefriw. Great volumes of water run off the mountains and when these meet high tide water large areas are flooded.Low-flying aircraft from RAF Valley Anglesey on radar avoidance practice make a great deal of noise, some of it very sudden when speeds exceed that of sound.
THIS INFORMATION WAS COMPILED BY: Trefriw Women's Institute Entered on the computer by Mr F Dillien BSc, from contributions by Mrs P Barker, Mrs C Cornish, Mrs E James, Mrs. E. Mills, Mrs. F. Smith, Mrs C Birch, Mrs R Evans, edited by Mrs G Williams
